generalInfo: This is a journey to the extreme territories of Patagonia, both in Argentina and Chile. In this full itinerary you will be able to visit the capital city of Buenos Aires and meet the wildlife of Peninsula de Valdes, with an overnight stay in the suggestive lighthouse of Punta Delgada. Time to drive along the Chubut valley, you will be surprised by the importance of the local Welsh community. The winding scenic roads of the Lake District will offer a beautiful setting to your self-driving experience. Once in Chile, with a border crossing through the Andes, you will drive to Puerto Varas, surrounded by glacier lakes, green forests and snow-capped volcanoes. Finally, visit the two most visited National Parks, Torres del Paine in Chile and Los Glaciares in Argentina with its famous Perito Moreno Glacier. Fly back to Buenos Aires.

dayInfo.description: After landing in Buenos Aires, you will be met at the airport by your driver and transferred to your hotel in the city center. A member of TransHumans will meet you at the hotel to offer you some advice as well as providing you with the Road book and SIM card to be in contact with us if needed. Wander around the capital city, soaking up the atmosphere and visiting the most picturesque areas: El Caminito and San Telmo, at the origins of Tango, then the ancient harbor, heart of the city. At night, take a walk in Puerto Madero area, an old harbor reconverted into a business area. Transport: Private transfer 1h >Accommodation: Hotel (Buenos Aires) >Included meals: none

Today you will drive south to Punta Tombo for a self-guided excursion to this Natural Reserve. This is the most important penguin colony in the Americas, a rocky strip 3.5 km long by 600 m wide extending seaward. Penguins arrive every year to this place to nest and mate, before making the journey back and returning the following year. Optional: before driving north to Puerto Madryn, you could reach the Port of Rawson and from there go on a 1 ½ hour navigation to see the Tonina dolphins (black and white). Transport: rental car 80 miles ~ 2h30 to Punta Tombo + 115 miles ~ 3h30 to Puerto Madryn > Accommodation: Hotel (Puerto Madryn) >Included meals: breakfast>Excursion to Tonina Dolphins not included (~ USD50)

Today you will drive to Peninsula Valdes wildlife reserve, a huge maternity ward for whales, penguins, sea elephants and lions among others. To reach the park you will have to go through the isthmus and then drive to Puerto Piramides, about 70 miles away, the starting point for your whale-watching tour. Whales arrive to Peninsula Valdes to mate and give birth to their calves. Tonight, we recommend you to spend the night in the Peninsula. Faro Punta Delgada is a simple hotel in a beautiful setting, an old post office, with its own lighthouse and surrounded by cliffs. Some activities available around the Hotel (guided walk in the Estancia, wildlife spotting and stargazing). Transport: rental car 100 miles, depending on the itinerary > Accommodation: Hotel (Peninsula Valdes) > Included meals: breakfast and dinner >Whale watching navigation included (subject to weather conditions) ~ 1h30

Enjoy the morning in this beautiful part of the peninsula. At a convenient time, you will leave for Caleta Valdés to observe sea elephants and lions, Magellan Penguins and possibly killer whales. In the late afternoon, you will drive back to Puerto Madryn. Transport: rental car ~ 100 miles depending on the itinerary > Accommodation: Hotel (Puerto Madryn) > Included meals: breakfast

In the morning, leave Puerto Madryn to start driving along the winding Rio Chubut on the Ruta 25, accompanied by high cliffs which ignite at sunset. This is the land of the legendary Tehuelche. Your final destination for the night is Los Altares in the Valle de los Altares (Altars Valley), a splendid ravine reminiscent of the Jurassic period. You will drive through various sites which used to be dwelled by the Welsh pioneers along what used to be the central Chubut Railway (Ferrocarril Patagonico) which operated from 1888 to 1961. Spend the night in a motel managed by ACA (Automovil Club Argentina) Argentina’s largest automobile association. Transport: rental car 220 miles ~ 6-7h > Accommodation: Hostel (Los Altares) > Included meals: breakfast

In the morning, leave from Los Altares to Tecka and finally Esquel where you will spend the night. You will continue along the Ruta 25 through the Argentinean Pampa until reaching the last backwater town of Tecka. In the distance, the Andes mountain range... Another 60 miles along the famous RUTA 40 and you will be in Esquel. About 20 miles before reaching Esquel you will come to a junction with Ruta 14 an off the beaten track route to Piedra Parada* (Standing Rock). Recommended stop! Esquel is a small Patagonian city embedded in a rough landscape, where the Patagonian steppe merges with the Andean forest. Here, the history and traditions of the Mapuche and Tehuelche peoples mingle with the saga of the Welsh settlers. Close to Esquel, Los Alerces National Park undoubtedly one of the best in Argentina. Overnight in Los Alerces National Park totally recommended. Transport: rental car 200 miles ~ 5h >Accommodation: Hotel (Esquel)>Included meals: breakfast

In the morning, you will leave for Bariloche, in the lake district. You are scheduled to arrive there in the late afternoon. Bariloche is the main town in Argentina's lake district, on the southern shore of Lake Nahuel Huapi. You could spend the rest of the day enjoying the area surrounding your beautiful hotel, located in the San Pedro peninsula. Transport: rental car 180 miles ~ 4h > Accommodation: Hotel (Bariloche) >Included meals: breakfast

Today we would recommend a visit to either the Cerro Campanario view point or Cerro Catedral ski resort for superb panoramas over the lakes and mountains. Bariloche is also a good base for scenic lakeshore drives and your hotel is perfectly located nearby. Today you could enjoy the Llao Llao peninsula with walking trails and picturesque drives around Lago Moreno. Transport: rental car / depending on route> Accommodation: Hotel (Bariloche) >Included meals: breakfast > Trekking: easy hikes /depending on trails

Today you could drive along the famous 7 lakes route, running north from Villa Langostura to San Martin de los Andes. The Ruta de los Siete Lagos (7 Lakes Route) travels past seven main lakes that look spectacular amidst snow-capped mountains and forests. Running through both the Lanin and Nahuel Huapi National Parks, this route is completely paved. Whilst there are lots of deviations off the main path, many of which are unpaved, the direct route is 110km in length and it can take as little as 1.5 hours to travel. Multiple stops will increase the travel time significantly. Throughout the day, you will stop at different viewpoints with various detours and hikes. Spend the night in San Martin de los Andes. Transport: rental car 70 miles OW / depending on route > Accommodation: Hotel (San Martin de los Andes) > Included meals: breakfast >Trekking: easy hikes /depending on trails

In the morning you could reach the Arrayanes lookout for beautiful views over Lake Lascar and San Martin de los Andes. Today we recommend you to do the big circuit to Villa Traful, through thick forest, strange rock formations and a stunning scenery, bordering the Limay River. Just like the previous day, you will stop at different viewpoints with various detours and hikes. In Villa Traful, you could rest on the lake shores or go hiking to the small Cao Cò falls, a nice trail under the shady trees of the forest (coihue and ñire). Alternatively, you could spend the night in Villa La Angostura. Transport: rental car 80 miles OW unpaved /depending on route >Accommodation: Hotel (San Martin de los Andes) >Trekking: easy short hikes / depending on trails

Today you will leave Argentina to cross over the Andes all the way to Puerto Varas, in the Chilean Lake District. Head to Cardenal Antonio Samoré Pass, only about 20min drive from Villa Langostura. Leaving behind the Nahuel Huapi N. P., Argentine oldest National Park, you will reach the border between Chile and Argentina, at a height of 1314mts. After passing border controls, you will enter the jungle-like landscapes of the Valdivian humid woodlands, through the Puyehue National Park. Take you time to enjoy the scenery, stopping for lunch and finally get to your lodge over Lake Rupanco, with nice views over the Osorno and Puntiagudo Volcanoes. Spend the night in Puyehue. Transport: rental car 125 mi ~ 6h (depending on border crossing) >Accommodation: Hotel (Puyehue) > Included meals: Breakfast

Wake up in Chile’s Lake District, a green region, famous for its mystical quality. Today you will drive to Puerto Varas. This charming town is located on the shores of Llanquihue Lake (Chile’s second largest), framed by two snow-capped volcanoes, Osorno and Calbuco. In addition to the gorgeous scenery and lots of outdoor activities, the area’s diverse history provides a unique mix of culture. Once inhabited by the indigenous Huilliche people, the region was conquered by the Spanish in the 1540s. Later, in the 1850s, German settlers from Hamburg began to put down roots. As a result, many of the geographical names are in the Huilliche language, some of the area’s biggest attractions are hundreds of wooden churches built by Spanish Jesuit missionaries, and the architecture in several areas is distinctly German. On the way to Puerto Varas, we recommend you to stop at the lakeshore town of Puerto Octay, a charming town with a beautiful German-style architecture and the town of Frutillar, with streets lined with flower gardens and perfectly-maintained wooden buildings Transport: rental car 80 mi ~ 4h >Accommodation: Hotel (Pto Varas) > Included meals: breakfast

Leave in the morning to reach Parque Nacional Vicente Pérez Rosales and Petrohue Waterfalls. These spectacular waterfalls of Saltos de Petrohue are at the foot of the imposing Osorno Volcano in the Andes Precordillera. This Park also offers different treks that vary in terms of difficulty. Three of the treks can be completed in one day or less: the “Trek El Rincon,” which involves hiking along the base of Volcán Osorno through ancient landslides and native forests; the “Desolation Pass Trek”; and the Trek Paso los Pumas,” a full-day adventure that includes boating across Lago de Los Santos, crossing creeks and walking through a valley of endangered alerce trees. If you feel adventurous you could go white-water rafting on the Petrohué River or just kayaking on Lake Llanquihue back in PuertoVaras. Transport: rental car 40 mi ~1h30 > Accommodation: Hotel (Pto Varas) >Included meals: breakfast > Self-guided trekking: depending on treks

Today is your last day in the lake region before moving to the southern part of Chile. You might want to relax in your hotel, wander around Puerto Varas and Lake Llanquihue. Alternatively, we could recommend you some nice excursions, including the alerce forests, with deep valleys, lakes and lagoons. Transport: rental car : depending on chosen activities > Accommodation: Hotel (Pto Varas) > Included meals: breakfast

In the morning, you will head for Puerto Montt airport where you will return your rental car before boarding a flight to Punta Arenas. Once arrived in Punta Arenas, a private transfer will take you to your hotel in Torres del Paine National park. This is the perfect place to relax and unwind. A region of great beauty, with a diverse variety of plant and animal species, breath-taking scenery and wild geography. It is also an ideal place to enjoy some unforgettable trekking. Transportation: private transfer 200 miles ~ 5h > Accommodation: Hotel (Torres del Paine) >Included meals: breakfast >Entrance to the Park not included (~ USD35)

Today you will wake up in Torres del Paine National Park. Take some time to enjoy your hotel, located on the shores of Lake Grey. While in the Grey sector, we recommend you to enjoy a cruise over LAKE Grey, lasting about 3 hours, reaching Grey Glacier’s face. The blue-coloured ice and jagged ice peaks are simply amazing. In the afternoon, you could stroll around the lake or, if you feel like it, you could hike to Mirador Monte Ferrier for some amazing views (challenging ascent - 6 miles ~ 5h). THE TREK CAN BE SELF-GUIDED OR WITH A BILINGUAL GUIDE (~ USD 60 p.p.) LAKE GREY CRUISE (~ USD 100 p.p.) Accommodation: Hotel (Torres del Paine) >Included meals: breakfast >Guided hikes and cruise not included (minimum number of pax applies to the cruise)

Today, you will be transferred to the north side of the park, to hotel Las Torres. Ideally, before moving to your next accommodation, you will visit Salto Grande waterfall half way between the two hotels. This is a relatively easy excursion taking you to this spectacular waterfall and an astonishing viewpoint. The excursion starts with a 45-minute drive to Pudeto in the heart of the park’s lake district. From there a trail will lead you first to Salto Grande then to Mirador Cuernos, possibly the Park’s most spectacular viewpoint, offering views of the “Horns” (Los Cuernos), Mount Paine Grande and the French Valley and Glacier rising straight up from the the other side of Lake Nordenskjöld. (3.7miles ~ 2h). At the end of this excursion you will reach hotel Las Torres. BILINGUAL GUIDED TOUR (~ USD 100 p.p.) Transportation: private transfer 45 mi ~ 1h30 > Accommodation: Hotel (Torres del Paine) > Included meals: Breakfast > Guided hikes not included

Today you will continue to enjoy the beauty of the park, waking up in a different part of the park, in Hotel las Torres. In the afternoon, we recommend you a short hike, part of the famous “W” trails, that stretches between the Lake Nordenskjold gorgeous north shore and the hanging glacier of Monte Almirante Nieto (4.3miles ~ 1h30). This can be easily done on your own. THE TREK CAN BE SELF-GUIDED OR WITH A BILINGUAL GUIDE (~ USD 100p.p.) Accommodation: Hotel (Torres del Paine) > Included meals: breakfast >Guided hikes not included

If you feel ready for a real adventure, you could set out on a full-day hiking to the base of Paine Towers (aprox. 8h – 11 miles return). You would need to leave early from your hotel, follow the trail, through a millenary Lenga forest to the base of “the moraine”, then a challenging 45-minute ascent will take you to one of the most impressive lookouts in the park, the famous Base of Torres del Paine. Please note that the last part of this trek is extremely rocky which might have an impact on your knees, with parts featuring steep drop offs than may induce vertigo. Otherwise there are plenty of half-day guided excursions to choose from (Laguna Azul – amazing views with little walking; Lenga Forest – 5-mile hike among Nothofagus trees; Rock Paintings – 4-mile hike to a rock formation with paintings from the ancient Aónikenk people of Patagonia). TREKS WITH A BILINGUAL GUIDE (from ~ USD 60 p.p.) Accommodation: Hotel (Torres del Paine) >Included meals: breakfast >Guided hikes not included

Leave in the morning to return to Argentina. We recommend you a private transfer from the Park to your hotel in EL Calafate. After crossing the border, you will arrive to the Argentine pampas with ñandus and guanacos. Spend the night in El Calafate. Transportation: Private transfer ~ 5h > Accommodation: Hotel (EL Calafate) > Included meals: breakfast

Leave at 7:15am from your hotel and start a cruise on Lake Argentino and its calm blue coloured waters. The navigation runs between fjords and floating icebergs of spectacular size and forms. Finally, you will approach the majestic fronts of the Glaciers Upsala and Spegazzini. Return to El Calafate at the end of the afternoon. Transport: Bilingual group service + Cruise on Lake Argentino ~ 6 h > Accommodation: Hotel (EL Calafate) >Included meals: breakfast >Entrance to the park not included ~ USD 25

Experience the famous Perito Moreno Glacier. This is the most active glacier in Patagonia and with some luck you will hear the terrible cracking noise and possibly observe a massive block of ice falling into Lake Argentino. Depart from your hotel for the Los Glaciares National Park following the old road that borders the lake. Stop just a few kilometres from Perito Moreno glacier to enjoy a short hike to admire the glacier along the arm of Lake Rico. Inside the park, reach the main observation point and later enjoy different perspectives of Perito Moreno from the many viewpoints. Enjoy this amazing show of ice from up-close. Back to El Calafate by the conventional route. NAVIGATION (~ USD 100 p.p.) Transport: bilingual speaking group service> Accommodation: Hotel (EL Calafate) >Included meals: breakfast >Entrance to the park not included ~ USD 25

Time to leave Patagonia Transfer to El Calafate airport to board a flight to Buenos Aires. Private transfer to your hotel. Free time in the capital. Transportation: transfer 30 min x 2 > Accommodation: Hotel (Buenos Aires) > Included meals: breakfast

Another day for you to continue exploring Buenos Aires. You can choose to take a walk downtown to the Pink House (Government) and Congress, or enjoy the parks and nice buildings of Recoleta and Palermo. In these neighbourhoods, you will find interesting museums as well as Plaza Francia, with its craftsman fair and Tango dancers. Accommodation: Hotel (Buenos Aires) >Included meals: breakfast >Private Bilingual guided tour included~ 4 h

Enjoy a free day. Our suggestions: SAN ANTONIO DE ARECO, a traditional gaucho town in the hearth of the Pampa. Learn about the lifestyle of the Gauchos in a traditional estancia. Taste a good piece of beef, the legendary asado Argentino and stroll on horseback or by horse buggy. EL TIGRE, a residential suburb located on the delta of the Parana River. It offers pleasant walks along the river and sailing tours. GUIDED TOUR CAN BE ARRANGED FOR YOU. Accommodation: Hotel (Buenos Aires) > Included meals: breakfast & dinner with Tango show

Your driver will pick you up at your hotel in Buenos Aires and take you to the airport, about 4 hours before departure of your flight. Transportation: private transfer 45 min > Included meals: breakfast
